page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: An aspect of{local History}in the Lundwood area is Monk Bretton Priory which is situated on Grange Lane. It is one of Barnsley's {historical remains.}It was founded in 1154. Before it was built Barnsley,Monk Bretton and Lundwood were huge forests and wastelands. The wood was called "The wood of Lund" which was eventually reversed and became Lundwood. The{ruins}of the Priory are open to visitors. {Ruins} of the Posterns Lodge, where the postern who looked after the gates lived,can be seen. Also the{ruins}of the almony can be visited. This was where poor and sick people went and they would be given Alms in a small amount which was their money. These are the{ruins}of the church, a priors room, a guest house, cellar, infirmary.
